noun.description: An explosive white crystalline compound, CH(NO₂)₃, which is a derivative of methane having three nitro groups attached to the carbon atom; trinitromethane.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Henry Watts (1815–1884), chemist. From nitro- + -form, after German Nitroform (L. Schischkoff 1857)<br>1950s; earliest use found in The Official Gazette. From nitro- + -form.
